habitat_description: Highly aquatic snake mainly found in or near water, but does move away from water during wet weather. Also found in river bottoms, swamps, springs, wooded borders of streams, rivers, ponds, and lakes. Found in altitudes ranging from sea level to around 2040 m (Stebbins 2003).  The distribution of the plain-bellied water snake includes southern Michigan and southern Delaware to the Gulf Coast and Nuevo Leon, Oklahoma, and southeastern New Mexico, and some isolated populations in Durango and Zacatecas, Mexico. In New Mexico, this species is restricted to the lower Pecos River drainage, the Black and Delaware rivers, and Rocky Arroyo from 900m to 1100m approximately. This species is restricted to rivers and intermittent streams with large and deep pools remain (Degenhardt et al. 1996).
